tr.td: Member/caregiver knowledgeable in health maintenance and prevention strategies
Identify and Eliminate underlying conditions or stressors that contribute to behavioral problems.
Member with Medium Medical, Behavioral, Social and/or Long Term Service and Support Needs will have ongoing Care Management Contact and Visits
Member will reverse functional loss resulting from a recent, acute, event or condition.

observation.value: Member/caregiver knowledgeable in health maintenance and prevention strategies
Identify and Eliminate underlying conditions or stressors that contribute to behavioral problems.
Member with Medium Medical, Behavioral, Social and/or Long Term Service and Support Needs will have ongoing Care Management Contact and Visits
Member will reverse functional loss resulting from a recent, acute, event or condition.

tr.td: Case Manager facilitates and coordinates with obtaining appropriate care assistance

CM will obtain a history of the member's troubling behaviors to include: the onset, duration and severity of the behaviors; the member's perception of the behaviors and the precipitating factors; the identified measures that have been found to mitigate the troubling behaviors.

CM will obtain a history of the member's comorbidities, including new physical or behavioral health problems, or a flare-up of a known chronic condition that may be causing or aggravating a behavior symptom.
CM will preform a medication reconciliation.

CM/ICT/Waiver Service Coordinator will complete Face to Face visits with the Medium Risk member, per the following schedule: For months 0-2 there will be 1 visit. For months 3-6 there will be at least 2 visits with a maximum of 60 days between visits. For month 7 until the conclusion of the Demonstration, there will be at least 1 visit every 3 months, with a maximum of 90 days between visits. CM/ICT/Waiver Service Coordinator will make Monthly Telephonic Contact with the member from month 7 until the conclusion of the Demonstration and will also make Telephonic Contact as needed from month 0 until the conclusion of the Demonstration.
CM will assess the member/family/caregiver to identify functional declines that are related to a recent, acute, event or condition.
CM will link the member with healthcare providers for the evaluation and treatment of medical problems and associated functional decline.
CM will educate the member/family/caregiver on care interventions to reduce functional loss, increase ADL self-performance and return the member to his/her previous functional level.
